Class SimpleComponentDatabase

All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentDatabaseInterface
public final class SimpleComponentDatabase
extends Object

Database holding property and event information of Simple components.

Author:
lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney)

getCategoryString

public String getCategoryString(String componentTypeName)
Description copied from interface: ComponentDatabaseInterface
Returns the String version of a component's category. Note that this is the result of calling getString() on a ComponentCategory, not the result of calling getName(). For example, for the ComponentCategory EXPERIMENTAL, this returns "EXPERIMENTAL", not "Not ready for prime time". The procedure was written this way so that the result could be converted back to a ComponentCategory with valueOf().

Specified by:
getCategoryString in interface ComponentDatabaseInterface
Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
the component's category

getHelpString

public String getHelpString(String componentTypeName)
Description copied from interface: ComponentDatabaseInterface
Returns a helpful message about the component. This message originates in the designerHelpDescription field of the component's DesignerComponent annotation, is written to the file "simple_component.json" by ComponentDescriptorGenerator, and is read back by YoungAndroidPalettePanel. It is not allowed to contain HTML or XML markup.

Specified by:
getHelpString in interface ComponentDatabaseInterface
Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
helpful message about the component

getShowOnPalette

public boolean getShowOnPalette(String componentTypeName)
Description copied from interface: ComponentDatabaseInterface
Returns whether the component with this name should be shown on the palette. As the time this is written (2/22/10), the only component that should not be shown on the palette is Form/Screen.

Specified by:
getShowOnPalette in interface ComponentDatabaseInterface
Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
whether the component should be shown on the palette

getNonVisible

public boolean getNonVisible(String componentTypeName)
Description copied from interface: ComponentDatabaseInterface
Returns whether the component with this name is a "non-visible" component (i.e., one that doesn't have a representation in the UI). Non-visible components can be handled uniformly in the Designer and don't need special MockComponent representations.

Specified by:
getNonVisible in interface ComponentDatabaseInterface
Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
whether the component is non-visible
